verses.verse: Now the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH1961> to me saying,<WH559>

"Go<WH1980> and proclaim<WH7121> in the ears<WH241> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> saying,<WH559> 'Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "I remember<WH2142> concerning you the devotion<WH2617> of your youth,<WH5271> The love<WH160> of your betrothals,<WH3623> Your following<WH1980> after<WH310> Me in the wilderness,<WH4057> Through a land<WH776> not sown.<WH2232>

"Israel<WH3478> was holy<WH6944> to the Lord,<WH3068> The first<WH7225> of His harvest;<WH8393> All<WH3605> who ate<WH398> of it became<WH816> guilty;<WH816> Evil<WH9567> came<WH935> upon them," declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>'"
Hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of the Lord,<WH3068> O house<WH1004> of Jacob,<WH3290> and all<WH3605> the families<WH4940> of the house<WH1004> of Israel.<WH3478>

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "What<WH4100> injustice<WH5766> did your fathers find<WH1> in Me, That they went<WH4672> far<WH7368> from Me And walked<WH7368> after<WH1980> emptiness<WH310> and became<WH1892> empty<WH1891>?

"And they did not say,<WH559> 'Where<WH346> is the Lord<WH3068> Who brought<WH5927> us up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> Who led<WH1980> us through the wilderness,<WH4057> Through a land<WH776> of deserts<WH6160> and of pits,<WH7745> Through a land<WH776> of drought<WH6723> and of deep<WH6757> darkness,<WH6757> Through a land<WH776> that no<WH3808> one<WH376> crossed<WH5674> And where<WH8033> no<WH3808> man<WH120> dwelt<WH3427>?'

"And I brought<WH935> you into the fruitful<WH3759> land,<WH776> To eat<WH398> its fruit<WH6529> and its good<WH2898> things.<WH2898> But you came<WH935> and defiled<WH2930> My land,<WH776> And My inheritance<WH5159> you made<WH7760> an abomination.<WH8441>

"The priests<WH3548> did not say,<WH559> 'Where<WH346> is the Lord<WH3068>?' And those who handle<WH8610> the law<WH8451> did not know<WH3045> Me; The rulers<WH7462> also transgressed<WH6586> against Me, And the prophets<WH5030> prophesied<WH5012> by Baal<WH1168> And walked<WH1980> after<WH310> things that did not profit.<WH3276>
"Therefore<WH3651> I will yet<WH5750> contend<WH7378> with you," declares<WH5002> the Lord,<WH3068> "And with your sons<WH1121>' sons I will contend.<WH7378>

"For cross<WH5674> to the coastlands<WH339> of Kittim<WH3794> and see,<WH7200> And send<WH7971> to Kedar<WH6938> and observe<WH995> closely,<WH3966> And see<WH7200> if<WH2005> there has been<WH1961> such [a thing] as this!<WH384>
"Has a nation<WH1471> changed<WH4171> gods,<WH430> When they were not gods<WH430>? But My people<WH5971> have changed<WH4171> their glory<WH9202> For that which does not profit.<WH3276>
"Be appalled,<WH8074> O heavens,<WH8064> at this,<WH384> And shudder,<WH8175> be very<WH3966> desolate,<WH2717>" declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>

"For My people<WH5971> have committed<WH6213> two<WH8147> evils:<WH7451> They have forsaken<WH5800> Me, The fountain<WH4726> of living<WH2416> waters,<WH4325> To hew<WH2672> for themselves cisterns,<WH877> Broken<WH7665> cisterns,<WH877> That can<WH3201> hold<WH3557> no<WH3808> water.<WH4325>
"Is Israel<WH3478> a slave<WH5650>? Or<WH518> is he a homeborn<WH3211> <WH1004> servant? Why<WH4069> has he become<WH1961> a prey<WH957>?

"The young<WH3715> lions<WH3715> have roared<WH7580> at him, They have roared<WH5414> <WH6963> loudly.<WH5414> <WH6963> And they have made<WH7896> his land<WH776> a waste;<WH8047> His cities<WH5892> have been destroyed,<WH9342> without<WH1097> inhabitant.<WH3427>
"Also<WH1571> the men<WH1121> of Memphis<WH5297> and Tahpanhes<WH8471> Have shaved<WH7462> the crown<WH6936> of your head.<WH6936>
"Have you not done<WH6213> this<WH384> to yourself, By your forsaking<WH5800> the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> When<WH6256> He led<WH1980> you in the way<WH1870>?

"But now<WH6258> what<WH4100> are you doing on the road<WH1870> to Egypt,<WH4714> To drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of the Nile<WH7883>? Or what<WH4100> are you doing on the road<WH1870> to Assyria,<WH804> To drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of the Euphrates<WH5104>?

"Your own wickedness<WH9567> will correct<WH3256> you, And your apostasies<WH4878> will reprove<WH3198> you; Know<WH3045> therefore and see<WH7200> that it is evil<WH7451> and bitter<WH4751> For you to forsake<WH5800> the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> And the dread<WH6345> of Me is not in you," declares<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> God<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>

"For long<WH5769> ago<WH5769> I broke<WH7665> your yoke<WH5923> [And] tore<WH5423> off<WH5423> your bonds;<WH4147> But you said,<WH559> 'I will not serve!<WH5647>' For on every<WH3605> high<WH1364> hill<WH1389> And under<WH8478> every<WH3605> green<WH7488> tree<WH6086> You have lain<WH6808> down<WH6808> as a harlot.<WH2181>

"Yet I planted<WH5193> you a choice<WH8321> vine,<WH8321> A completely<WH3605> faithful<WH571> seed.<WH2233> How<WH349> then have you turned<WH2015> yourself before Me Into the degenerate<WH5493> shoots of a foreign<WH5237> vine<WH1612>?

"Although<WH3588> <WH518> you wash<WH3526> yourself with lye<WH5427> And use<WH7235> much<WH7235> soap,<WH1287> The stain<WH3799> of your iniquity<WH5771> is before<WH6440> Me," declares<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> God.<WH3068>

"How<WH349> can you say,<WH559> 'I am not defiled,<WH2930> I have not gone<WH1980> after<WH310> the Baals<WH1168>'? Look<WH7200> at your way<WH1870> in the valley!<WH1516> Know<WH3045> what<WH4100> you have done!<WH6213> You are a swift<WH7031> young<WH1072> camel<WH1072> entangling<WH8308> her ways,<WH1870>

A wild<WH6501> donkey<WH6501> accustomed<WH3928> to the wilderness,<WH4057> That sniffs<WH7602> the wind<WH7307> in her passion.<WH185> <WH5315> In [the time of] her heat<WH8385> who<WH4310> can turn<WH7725> her away<WH7725>? All<WH3605> who seek<WH1245> her will not become<WH3286> weary;<WH3286> In her month<WH2320> they will find<WH4672> her.

"Keep<WH4513> your feet<WH7272> from being unshod<WH3182> And your throat<WH1627> from thirst;<WH6773> But you said,<WH559> 'It is hopeless!<WH2976> No!<WH3808> For I have loved<WH157> strangers,<WH2114> And after<WH310> them I will walk.<WH1980>'

"As the thief<WH1590> is shamed<WH954> when<WH3588> he is discovered,<WH4672> So<WH3651> the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> is shamed;<WH954> They, their kings,<WH4428> their princes,<WH8269> And their priests,<WH3548> and their prophets,<WH5030>

Who say<WH559> to a tree,<WH6086> 'You are my father,' And to a stone,<WH1> 'You gave<WH68> me birth.<WH3205>' For they have turned<WH3205> [their] back<WH6437> to Me, And not [their] face;<WH6203> But in the time<WH6440> of their trouble<WH6256> they will say,<WH9567> 'Arise<WH559> and save<WH6965> us.'

"But where<WH346> are your gods<WH430> Which<WH834> you made<WH6213> for yourself? Let them arise,<WH6965> if<WH518> they can save<WH3467> you In the time<WH6256> of your trouble;<WH9567> For [according to] the number<WH4557> of your cities<WH5892> Are your gods,<WH430> O Judah.<WH3063>
"Why<WH4100> do you contend<WH7378> with Me? You have all<WH3605> transgressed<WH6586> against Me," declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>

"In vain<WH7723> I have struck<WH5221> your sons;<WH1121> They accepted<WH3947> no<WH3808> chastening.<WH4148> Your sword<WH2719> has devoured<WH398> your prophets<WH5030> Like a destroying<WH7843> lion.<WH9030>

"O generation,<WH1755> heed<WH7200> the word<WH1697> of the Lord.<WH3068> Have I been<WH1961> a wilderness<WH4057> to Israel,<WH3478> Or<WH518> a land<WH776> of thick<WH3991> darkness<WH3991>? Why<WH4069> do My people<WH5971> say,<WH559> 'We [are free to] roam;<WH7300> We will come<WH935> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> to Thee'?
"Can a virgin<WH1330> forget<WH7911> her ornaments,<WH5716> Or a bride<WH3618> her attire<WH7196>? Yet My people<WH5971> have forgotten<WH7911> Me Days<WH3117> without<WH369> number.<WH4557>
"How<WH4100> well<WH3190> you prepare<WH3190> your way<WH1870> To seek<WH1245> love!<WH160> Therefore<WH3651> even<WH1571> the wicked<WH7451> women<WH7451> You have taught<WH3925> your ways.<WH1870>

"Also<WH1571> on your skirts<WH3671> is found<WH4672> The lifeblood<WH1818> <WH5315> of the innocent<WH9345> poor;<WH34> You did not find<WH4672> them breaking<WH4290> in. But in spite<WH5921> of all<WH3605> these<WH428> things,<WH428>

Yet you said,<WH559> 'I am innocent;<WH5352> Surely<WH389> His anger<WH639> is turned<WH7725> away<WH7725> from me.' Behold,<WH2009> I will enter<WH8199> into judgment<WH8199> with you Because<WH5921> you say,<WH559> 'I have not sinned.<WH2398>'

"Why<WH4100> do you go<WH235> around so<WH3966> much<WH3966> Changing<WH8132> your way<WH1870>? Also,<WH1571> you shall be put<WH954> to shame<WH954> by Egypt<WH4714> As you were put<WH954> to shame<WH954> by Assyria.<WH804>

"From this<WH2088> [place] also<WH1571> you shall go<WH3318> out With your hands<WH3027> on your head;<WH7218> For the Lord<WH3068> has rejected<WH3988> those in whom<WH4009> you trust,<WH4009> And you shall not prosper<WH6743> with them."
